pullRequest.body:
From the FLT project.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [7093d77649](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19657/commits/7093d77649c78c2a68b7a7824be1390cea0f259b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ MonoidHom.isOpenQuotientMap_of_isQuotientMap`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This can be generalized to equivariant quotient maps (generalizing [MulAction.isOpenQuotientMap_quotientMk](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/ConstMulAction.html#MulAction.isOpenQuotientMap_quotientMk)), let me play a bit with it.

Actually what I suggested seems mostly useless and painful to use. And going the other way around (e.g by reducing the situation to [QuotientGroup.isOpenQuotientMap_mk](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Group/Quotient.html#QuotientGroup.isOpenQuotientMap_mk) is painful as well because of lacking API. Could you just add some `TODO: unify with QuotientGroup.isOpenQuotientMap_mk` ?

My instinct is that my claim in this PR (for surjective homomorphisms) is more general than any claim about `Quotient.mk`, which only applies to surjections of the form A -> A / N. In fact the result in this PR does not need surjectivity at all, there is a slightly more general statement just requiring that A -> B is "coinducing", but in all the applications I know we have surjectivity, and furthermore mathlib doesn't seem to have `Topology.IsCoinducing` even though it has `Topology.IsInducing`; we only seem to have `IsQuotientMap` (which is "surjective + coinducing"). I concluded that the concept of being coinducing is only useful in practice for surjections *shrug*.

The TODO is added.

Sorry I wasn't clear: what you wrote is indeed more general than [QuotientGroup.isOpenQuotientMap_mk](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Group/Quotient.html#QuotientGroup.isOpenQuotientMap_mk). My point is that it is not more general than [MulAction.isOpenQuotientMap_quotientMk](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/ConstMulAction.html#MulAction.isOpenQuotientMap_quotientMk), since the latter is about group *actions*. But the common generalization is a bit absurd to state.

About coinducing maps, the reason we don't have them is indeed that they are quite degenerate in the non-surjective case (but we should add them if that's needed of course): if `f : X -> Y` is coinducing, then `Y` is the topological sum of the range of `f` with the quotient topology and its complement with the coarsest topology.

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12321776421/job/34393888772)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12321776421/job/34393888997)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Algebra/Group/Basic): a quotient map between topological groups is open
